intro: Pennellia yalaensis, commonly known as the Yalaensis pennellia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features daisy-like flowers with ray florets and a central disk, often in shades of yellow or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
